text: Hi Llyr! Absolute pleasure to meet you. I am keeping well thanks, despite the chaos, and I hope you are too.
That must be quite an amazing job to have, do you get to work on a whole range of projects?

I'm in my final year at uni, I'm specializing in 3D animation - not yet sure where I'd like to advance in terms of character animation or creature animation. I started animating in 2D for fun in school and everything went from there haha! I use Maya for animation, I took a look at Houdini on my own and followed some tutorials a while ago, but you're right - steep learning curve! I'm afraid I haven't really progressed with it.

Most of our day to day work is vfx for Casualty. It's mostly cleanup and stabilising shots but we do occasionally get more interesting sequences to work on. We've also done quite a few feature films. Here's a link to our site incase you haven't seen it <http://baitstudio.com/>
We've started doing some CG crowd work. We developed a tool for a film we were working on but the release has been delayed due to Covid so we can't show off any of that work yet.

If you're interested in giving Houdini another look I can hook you up with some tutorials that helped me get to grips with it. Although I guess if you're concentrating on animation then Maya will be your focus. Creature work is one thing we keep talking about getting into.
